com.counterpath.api.bria

Class BriaApiTransferClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.neovisionaries.ws.client.WebSocketFactory
      • com.counterpath.api.bria.BriaApiTransferClient

  • public class BriaApiTransferClient
extends com.neovisionaries.ws.client.WebSocketFactory

    Disclaimer: This class inherits WebSocketFactory written by Takahiko Kawasaki. For full reference, please check github for the source code. It also uses NaiveSSLContext.java, written by the same author.

    Writes messages to a Bria web socket. Users of this class can consume messages by registering handlers to the MessageProcessor this class exposes. Usage examples:

    Writing

    The following code sends a logout message to the Bria client.

     
 BriaApiTransferClient apiClient = new BriaApiTransferClient(serverUri, clientListener);
 Message message = new MessageBuilder().logout.build();
 apiClient.writeMessage(message);

    Consuming a message

    The following code consumes a phone status response sent by the Bria client.

     BriaApiTransferClient apiClient = new BriaApiTransferClient(serverUri, clientListener);
 this.messageProcessor = apiClient.getMessageProcessor();
 this.messageProcessor.registerHandlerForMessageType(MessageBodyType.RESPONSE_STATUS_PHONE, new MessageHandler() {
        public void handle(Message message) {
                System.out.println(message);
        }
 });

    An application should only create a single BriaApiTransferClient during execution.

    See Also:
    Message, MessageBuilder, MessageProcessor

    • Constructor Detail

      • BriaApiTransferClient

        public BriaApiTransferClient(java.net.URI serverUri,
                             BriaApiTransferClient.BriaApiClientOpenListener listener)
        Creates a connection web socket to the serverUri.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the SSLContext.getInstance() call fails
        IOException - if fails to create a socket. Or, HTTP proxy handshake or SSL handshake failed.
